Description: The largest U.S. distributor of endoscopes and related equipment agreed to pay $623.2 million to resolve criminal charges and civil claims relating to a scheme to pay kickbacks to doctors and hospitals. A subsidiary of the distributor agreed to pay $22.8 million to resolve criminal charges relating to the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act in Latin America.

Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
NAICS Translation: 423450: Medical, Dental, and Hospital Equipment and Supplies Merchant Wholesalers
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Primary Offense: drug or medical equipment safety violation
Description: Olympus Medical Systems Corporation and a former senior executive in Japan pleaded guilty to failing to file required adverse event reports involving infections connected to duodenoscopes, and to continuing to sell the duodenoscopes in the United States despite those failures.

Olympus Corporation of the Americas agreed to pay $306 million as part of the settlement of multistate litigation alleging it paid illegal kickbacks to healthcare providers, in violation of federal and state False Claims Acts. This was part of a larger $646 million settlement involving the federal government; see the Violation Tracker entry at https://violationtracker.goodjobsfirst.org/violation-tracker/-olympus-corp-of-the-americas

The California Insurance Commissioner reached a $1.075 million settlement with medical supply company Olympus Corporation of the Americas over alleged illegal kickbacks to physicians, hospital employees and representatives to induce them to purchase Olympus medical equipment and supplies.
